name: Northumbria
startIntroPart1: King Eadwine of Northumbria, the first Christian king of Northumbria and a crucial role in the early Christianization of England. Your reign united the kingdom of Bernicia and Deira which then sparked a period of expansion and consolidation of Northumbrian power. Oh, King Edwin, can you once again unite the divided nations of the world? Can you create great prosperity once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Your land will be put into good use, do not worry!
attacked: You stand no chance against us, fool!
defeated: I have been defeated, my kingdom is yours.
introduction: Have you heard of our lord and savior Jesus Christ?
hateHello: What the hell do you want?
tradeRequest: Northumbria requires your support, but you will be repaid for it.
uniques: [+2 Faith, +2 Culture] <in cities following our religion>
Free [Great General] appears <after founding a religion>

name: Mercia
startIntroPart1: King Offa of Mercia. You consolidated your control of Midland peoples. Taking advantage of instability in the kingdom of Kent to establish yourself as overlord. In the 780s you extended Mercian Supremacy over most of southern England and regained complete control of the southeast. Oh, King Offa, can you once again unite the divided nations of the world? Can you expand your nation's domination once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
introduction: I am King of the Mercians, and you are?
tradeRequest: If you do not wish to be vanquished, I suggest you accept this trade.
uniques: [+1 Gold, +1 Culture] from each Trade Route
[+1 Production] from [Farm] tiles [in all cities] <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: Wessex
startIntroPart1: King Alfred of Wessex. You spent several years fighting Viking invasions, winning a decisive victory in the Battle of Edington and made an agreement with the Vikings, dividing England between Anglo-Saxon territory and the Viking-ruled Danelaw. You defended his kingdom against the Viking attempt at conquest, becoming the dominant ruler in England. Oh, Alfred, can you once again defend against foreign invaders? Can you once again become the dominant force? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
attacked: Who do you think you are?!
introduction: I am Alfred the Great, the king of Wessex.
tradeRequest: We offer you this kind trade.
uniques: [+1 Culture] from all [Culture] buildings
[+1 Gold] from all [Gold] buildings
[+25]% Strength <vs [Barbarian] units>

name: East Anglia
startIntroPart1: King Edmund of East Anglia. The Danelaw tried to erase your name from existance, but you prevailed, resisting the Viking forces till your death, turning you into a martyr which earned the respect of many Christians during that time. Oh, Edmund the Martyr, can you take revenge on the vikings who ravaged your name? Can you then unite the great kingdom of England? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
attacked: I will not let it happen again!
introduction: I am King Edmund of East Anglia, I hope we become friends or better.
tradeRequest: I love trading, it helps everyone!
uniques: [+1 Food, +1 Production] from each Trade Route
[+1 Food] from all [Lighthouse] buildings
[+1 Food] from all [Harbor] buildings

name: Sussex
startIntroPart1: Aelle of Sussex. You and three of your sons are said to have landed at a place called Cymensora and fought against the local Britons, resulting a victory in 491. You conquered many lands from the Britons, eventually forging your own petty kingdom of Sussex. Oh Aelle, can you wage war on your enemies and win? Can you conquer more land than you originally did? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
introduction: I am Aelle, and I claim this land for Sussex!
tradeRequest: It appears you have things I don't, how about we peacefully change that?
uniques: [+1 Culture, +1 Production] [in all cities] <starting from the [Classical era]>
[+1 Food] from [Farm] tiles [in all cities] <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: Essex
startIntroPart1: Saeberht of Essex. You are the first king of Essex to have converted to Christianity, helping the spread of the religion throughout the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms. Oh Saeberht of Essex, your rule is mostly forgotten. Can you create new history under your name? Can you actually fill out your wikipedia page with actual history instead of brief random facts? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
defeated: Wait! I am not ready yet!
introduction: Call me Saeberht, king of Essex.
tradeRequest: God bless you with this trade!
uniques: [+2 Gold] [in all coastal cities] <starting from the [Classical era]>
[+1 Food, +1 Production] from all [Harbor] buildings
[+1 Food] from [Fishing Boats] tiles [in all cities]

name: Kent
startIntroPart1: Hengist, the first king of Kent. You and your brother Horsa arrived in Britain at Ebbsfleet on the Isle of Thanet. For a time, you and your brother served as mercenaries for Vortigern, King of the Britons, but later you and your brother turned against him. Horsa was sadly killed fighting the Britons, but you successfully conquered Kent, becoming the forefather of its kings. Oh, Hengist, can you carve a new kingdom out of the ashes once more? Can you avenge your brother? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
attacked: I am surprised you even have the guts for it!
hateHello: How did you get in here?!
tradeRequest: Trade oh Trade, if I could take your resources forcefully I would!
uniques: [+25]% Strength <for [Embarked] units>
Defense bonus when embarked

name: Danelaw
startIntroPart1: Halfdan 'Whiteshirt' Ragnarsson. A Viking leader and a commander of the Great Heathen Army which invaded the Anglo-Saxon kingdoms of England, starting in 865. You were the first Viking King of Northumbria and a pretender to the throne of Kingdom of Dublin. Oh, Halfdan, can you lead another army to carve your own lands? Can you rule over the unruly and bloodthirsty vikings once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
defeated: I'll kill ya in the afterlife ya pig!
tradeRequest: I need some stuff lad, don't worry I won't steal it from ya.
uniques: [+3 Culture] [in all cities] <when at war> <starting from the [Classical era]>
All newly-trained [Water] units [in all cities] receive the [Isles Ship] promotion
[-1 Happiness] [in all cities] <when not at war>
No movement cost to pillage

name: Gwynedd
startIntroPart1: Cadwallon ap Cadfan. You are the King of the Britons who invaded and conquered Northumbria, defeating and killing its king, Edwin, prior to his own death in battle against Oswald of Bernicia. Your conquest of Northumbria, which you held for a year or two after Edwin died, made you one of the last recorded Celtic Britons to hold substantial territory in eastern Britain until the rise of the Welsh House of Tudor. Oh, Cadwallon. Can you once again overthrow the rulers of other civilizations? Can you become a legend to your people once more? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
defeated: I have no words... You have defeated me... But how...
introduction: Who are you and what do you want?
hateHello: Best you get out of my sight.
tradeRequest: I wish to share my prosperity with you.
uniques: New [Land] units start with [15] Experience [in all cities]
Gain [50] [Culture] <upon conquering a city>
Gain [50] [Gold] <upon conquering a city> <starting from the [Classical era]>
Gain [50] [Culture] <upon conquering a city> <starting from the [Medieval era]>

name: Dublin
startIntroPart1: Imar, better known as Ivar the Boneless. You a powerful Viking leader in Ireland and Scotland in the mid-late ninth century. You were the progenitor of the Uí Ímair dynasty, who would go on to dominate the Irish Sea region for several centuries. Oh, Ivan, can you once again settle yourself into greater history? Can you expand your legacy far across the world? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
defeated: I guess that wasn't a bad move...
introduction: I see you friend, what's up?!
uniques: [+15]% Strength <when attacking> <vs [City]>
[+2 Production] [in all coastal cities]

name: the Isles
startIntroPart1: Gofraid Ua Imair. a Viking leader who ruled Northumbria and the Isle of Man in the early 10th century. You are a grandson of Ímar and a member of the Uí Ímair. In 917, you and Sitric Cáech sailed separate fleets to Ireland where you won several battles against local kings. Sitric successfully recaptured Dublin and established himself as king, while you returned to England. You fought against Constantín mac Áeda, King of Scotland. The Battle of Corbridge allowed you to establish yourself as king at York. Oh, Ragnall, can you make yourself a great king once more? Can you defeat your enemies in battle? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
introduction: Call me Gofraid, do not be afraid.
hateHello: Ah! Of course it had to be you!
tradeRequest: Have you ever wondered how they deliver these resources?
uniques: [+20]% Production when constructing [Water] units [in all cities]
[+1] Movement <for [Water] units> <after discovering [Compass]>
[+10]% Strength <for [Water] units>

name: Deira
declaringWar: Hmm... I think I prefer you gone!
defeated: I suppose becoming apart of a larger empire isn't that bad.

name: Bernicia
declaringWar: May the gods have mercy on you!
attacked: This is futile! You can not defeat us!

name: Munster
declaringWar: Pissing us off has done you a great disfavor!
attacked: Hah! Hahah! Look at them! They think they can beat us!
defeated: I shall take you to the depths of- Oh, we lost?

name: Gwent
declaringWar: You are far too annoying, time to die.

name: Dumnonia
attacked: We shall defend against this and make a fool out of you!
